016package org.asciidoctor.asciidoclet;
017
018import jdk.javadoc.doclet.Reporter;
019
020import java.io.File;
021import java.nio.charset.Charset;
022import java.util.ArrayList;
023import java.util.Arrays;
024import java.util.List;
025import java.util.Optional;
026import java.util.stream.Stream;
027
028import static javax.tools.Diagnostic.Kind.WARNING;
029
030/**
031 * Provides an interface to the doclet options we are interested in.
032 */
033public class DocletOptions {
034
035    private final Reporter reporter;
036
037    private Charset encoding;
038    private File basedir;
039    private File stylesheet;
040    private File attributesFile;
041    private List<String> attributes;
042    private String gemPath;
043    private List<String> requires;
044    
045    /**
046     * Creates an {@link DocletOptions} object with a given {@link Reporter} object.
047     * @param reporter A {@link Reporter} object with which a new object is created.
048     */
049    public DocletOptions(Reporter reporter) {
050        this.reporter = reporter;
051        encoding = Charset.defaultCharset();
052        attributes = new ArrayList<>();
053        requires = new ArrayList<>();
054    }
055
056    void collect(AsciidocletOptions option, List<String> list) {
057        switch (option) {
058            case ENCODING:
059                encoding = Charset.forName(list.get(0));
060                break;
061            case BASEDIR:
062                basedir = new File(list.get(0));
063                break;
064            case STYLESHEET:
065                stylesheet = new File(list.get(0));
066                break;
067            case ATTRIBUTE:
068            case ATTRIBUTE_LONG:
069                splitTrimStream(list).forEach(attributes::add);
070                break;
071            case ATTRIBUTES_FILE:
072                attributesFile = new File(list.get(0));
073                break;
074            case GEM_PATH:
075                gemPath = list.get(0);
076                break;
077            case REQUIRE:
078            case REQUIRE_LONG:
079                splitTrimStream(list).forEach(requires::add);
080                break;
081        }
082    }
083
084    private Stream<String> splitTrimStream(List<String> list) {
085        return list.stream()
086                .flatMap(s -> Arrays.stream(s.split("\\s*,\\s*")))
087                .map(String::trim)
088                .filter(s -> !s.isEmpty());
089    }
090
091    void validateOptions() {
092        if (baseDir().isEmpty()) {
093            printWarning(AsciidocletOptions.BASEDIR + " must be present for includes or file reference features to work properly");
094        }
095
096        Optional<File> attrsFile = attributesFile();
097        if (attrsFile.isPresent() && !attrsFile.get().canRead()) {
098            printWarning("Cannot read attributes file " + attrsFile.get());
099        }
100    }
101
102    private void printWarning(String message) {
103        reporter.print(WARNING, message);
104    }
105
106    Optional<File> stylesheet() {
107        return Optional.ofNullable(stylesheet);
108    }
109
110    Optional<File> baseDir() {
111        return Optional.ofNullable(basedir);
112    }
113
114    Charset encoding() {
115        return encoding;
116    }
117
118    List<String> attributes() {
119        return attributes;
120    }
121
122    Optional<File> attributesFile() {
123        if (attributesFile == null) {
124            return Optional.empty();
125        }
126        if (!attributesFile.isAbsolute() && baseDir().isPresent()) {
127            return Optional.of(new File(baseDir().get(), attributesFile.getPath()));
128        }
129        return Optional.of(attributesFile);
130    }
131
132    String gemPath() {
133        return gemPath;
134    }
135
136    List<String> requires() {
137        return requires;
138    }
139
140}
